title: No children node listed when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not being listed. This issue can be observed by following these steps: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. The new data source should not have any database, table, or column information. Actual result: There is no listing of children nodes when changing the data source for a data set on the data set editor page of the query tab. Additionally, closing and reopening the data set editor does not resolve the issue.
SR: Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. Ensure that the new data source does not have any database, table, or column information. 3. Open the data set editor page in the query tab. 4. Attempt to change the data source for the data set. 5. Observe that the children nodes are not listed. 6. Close the data set editor. 7. Reopen the data set editor. 8. Confirm that the issue persists.
